titleStmt.title: The declaration of the armie under His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, as it was lately presented at Saffron-Walden in Essex, unto Major-Generall Skippon, Lievtenant-General Cromwell, Commissary-General Ireton, and Colonell Fleetwood, members of the House of Commons, and commissioners there for the Parliament, by Colonell Whaley, Colonell Rich, Colonell Hammond, Colonell Lambert, Colonell Okey, Colonell Hewson, and Major Disborow, with the names of two hundred thirty and more commission-officers annexed. Which declaration is to manifest and set forth to them, they being members of Parliament, and of the army, the armies reall love and diligent care to discharge that duty for which they were raised, as will manifestly appeare in time to all that wish well to mercy, peace, and justice.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army.
England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the appointment of the officers, whose names are hereunto subscribed.,

notesStmt.note: "A declaration of the Lords and Commons" at the foot of the last page is dated: 30 March 1647.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 4th London 1647"; the final 6 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
